page.title: 13Wormleighton Crop Rotation
page.content: Crop rotation is still carried on by a minority of farmers who are concerned that the land should be well cared for. Hall Farm has over one thousand acres and their crop rotation is as follows - firstly grass, three wheat crops, a barley crop, and finally oil seed rape or oats, returning to grass on the seventh year. Some farmers practice intensive farming which produces corn continuously but even today with all the chemicals and fertilisers used many farmers suspect that this land will eventually be worked out.
